definition: to stutter
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail
stammeringly

sentences.english: The little child stammers in the presence of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 那小阿在陌生人面前說話就結巴。

sentences.english: And you don't want to stutter and stammer.
sentences.chinese: 而你又不想結結巴巴地說。

sentences.english: You got me trippin, stumbling, flippin, fumbling.
sentences.chinese: 你令我支吾，結巴，冒失，犯錯，笨拙。

sentences.english: Bex: Looks like you're still tied up.
She stumbled over the long word .
sentences.chinese: 她結結巴巴地說那個長詞。

sentences.english: Whenever I talk in front of an audience, I got tongue-tied.
sentences.chinese: 一面對不雅衆講話，我就結結巴巴的。

sentences.english: He ordered, with only a mild stammer as he flourished the bumbershoot .
sentences.chinese: 他命令道，帶着輕微的結巴，揮舞着雨傘。

sentences.english: The man was a poor lecturer because he hummed and hawed too much.
sentences.chinese: 這個人講課不行，因爲他太結巴了。

sentences.english: The little child stammers in the presence of strangers.
sentences.chinese: 那小孩在陌生人面前說話就結巴。

sentences.english: He jerked out his story to his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他結結巴巴地向老闆講了事情經過。

sentences.english: He stammered his cheek hot one much time.
sentences.chinese: 他結結巴巴地說着，不盡又紅了臉。

sentences.english: He began to sputter his reply.
sentences.chinese: 他開始結結巴巴地回答。

sentences.english: He splattered that he didn't see her.
sentences.chinese: 他結結巴巴地說，他沒有見到她。

sentences.english: She faltered out a few words.
sentences.chinese: 他結結巴巴說出幾個字來。

definition: lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
any Tom, Dick or Harry/anyone (contemptuous)
tongue-twister
happily/giddily
to lisp/unclear articulation/inarticulate
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to write from memory
ability/skill
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
to step down gracefully (humble expression)/to concede defeat/to play second fiddle
to use one's brains/to think
lacking class/boorish/poor quality/substandard
stammeringly
